data.title: Claus, Graf Schenk Von Stauffenberg Biography
data.meta_description: A behind-the-scene look at the life of Claus von Stauffenberg.
data.text:
Claus von Stauffenberg was the key figure in the July 20, 1944, assassination attempt on Adolf Hitler, known as the July 20 plot or Operation Valkyrie.

Claus von Stauffenberg was executed by firing squad on July 21, 1944, following the failure of the assassination attempt on Adolf Hitler.

Some of the key co-conspirators in the July 20 plot alongside Claus von Stauffenberg included General Friedrich Olbricht, General Ludwig Beck, and General Erwin von Witzleben.

Claus von Stauffenberg's actions in the July 20 plot inspired and motivated other resistance movements within Germany to oppose the Nazi regime, despite the failure of the assassination attempt.

Claus von Stauffenberg was known for his impeccable fashion sense, often being seen in tailored suits and stylish accessories.

Stauffenberg had a great love for music and was an accomplished pianist, finding solace and inspiration in playing the piano.

He was an avid reader and had a passion for literature, often engaging in intellectual conversations with his peers.
